sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As top European lawmakers call for a ceasefire in Gaza, eight trucks at the Rafah crossing are looted by desperate civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As its soldiers push on with the operation to destroy Hamas, Israel is facing growing calls for a ceasefire from some of its closest allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It comes after Israeli forces mistakenly killed three Israeli hostages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The war has flattened swathes of northern Gaza, killed thousands of civilians and driven most of the population to the southern part of the besieged territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Palestinian population is surviving off a trickle of humanitarian aid. On Sunday, dozens surrounded aid trucks after they passed through the Rafah crossing with Egypt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They forced it to stop and then scrambled to get their hands on the cargo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Israel has now agreed to open one of its own border crossings into Gaza at Kerem Shalom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A group of four European lawmakers are adding their voices to calls for a ceasefire following their trip to the Rafah crossing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The lawmakers are from France, Sweden and Ireland and are affiliated with the Centris Renew Europe parliamentary group.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: There is an almost general will to stop the fire, in favor of the civilian population of Gaza, but also to find a solution for the hostages who are in the hands of Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin is on a multi-day trip to the Middle East.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: While underscoring U.S. commitment to Israel's right to defend itself, he is there to persuade Israel into taking action to mitigate civilian harm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Serbia's governing populists celebrated a sweeping victory in parliamentary elections on Sunday evening, despite reports of major voting irregularities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: President Aleksandar Vucic is ruling Serbian Progressive Party, or SNS, won 47% of the vote, landing them sub-130 seats in the 250-member assembly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: but one list, Serbia must not stay, will have the absolute majority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The main opposition, centrist coalition Serbia Against Violence, took home only 23% of the vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Analysts say an opposition victory in the capital would have seriously dented the populists, who have ruled the troubled Balkan state since 2012.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Before the vote started on Sunday, some campaign monitors reported pressure on voters, fear-mongering and abuse of public office and institutions by the authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There has also been reports of vote-buying and vote-briving. boat buying and boat bribing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: One man was killed in an overnight Russian strike on the Ukrainian port city of Odessa on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Odessa's regional governor said debris from a downed drone fell onto a home in the city and ignited a fire which destroyed three residential buildings and a sports equipment warehouse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In the morning, residents picked through the rubble.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia and Ukraine are continuing to launch dozens of drones at each other's territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Both sides have stepped up drone attacks over the past month, both keen to show they aren't deadlocked as the war approaches the two-year mark.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: war approaches the two-year mark. In his first campaign speech before running again for president in a March election, Russian President Vladimir Putin has promised to make Russia a sovereign, self-sufficient power in the face of the West. He also accused the West of unsuccessfully trying to sow internal troubles. Meanwhile, in Poland, there has been a rally calling for the release of Ukrainian prisoners of war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Banners were displayed with messages such as Help Heroes of Ukraine and Ukrainian Children Yearn for a Christmas Without War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The demonstration was coordinated by Ukrainian residents in Warsaw and other cities in Poland with the backing of Polish activists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over 100,000 refugees from Ukraine have arrived in Ireland since the Russian attack there began

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: in February 2022. The influx has put severe pressure on accommodation, a matter that was dismissed by then-Thysiak Michal Martin in July of last year. My experience of people across the length and breadth of this country is of a great warmth and communities are working with the Ukrainian community to make them feel welcome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The Irish government will now reduce its welfare payments from €220 per week to just €38.80 per week, a move that is designed to discourage people coming to Ireland. Ireland has taken 100,000 Ukrainian refugees so far, 75,000 of those have been given state-provided accommodation and the system really is at full capacity. But they've come to the acceptance that they can no longer continue to give the same level of entitlements.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The real cause of concern is the large number of Ukrainian refugees that seek international protection in other EU states, but then migrate to Ireland, where welfare payments are more generous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Under the new policy, state-provided accommodation will only be provided for 90 days, after which those seeking international protection must find their own place to stay.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: No member of the Irish government was available for comment and the proposed change in policy is seen by some as a development that will create more problems than it will solve.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Where will these people go, predominantly women and children, if at the end of 90 days they don't have necessarily work because they don't have English or they have childcare and how can they find accommodation in a private rented market here in Ireland which is extremely under pressure anyway. Ireland has always been a popular destination for people seeking international protection however with a scarcity of accommodation making some political parties very unpopular the government has decided that enough is enough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: From next month, the signs are that if people from Ukraine are seeking international protection in Ireland, they just may have to go elsewhere.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is Ken Murray for Euronews in Dublin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Peace marches have been held across Europe demanding an end to the Israel Hamas war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Brussels on Sunday, nearly 30.000 mensen naar de straat gekomen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: En het Israëls-governement bevindt ook een afspraak van een afspraak van een van zijn dichtstbijste Europese alliërs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Frankrijk heeft ze het meest gepressteerd, afspraak van een directe afspraak, die veel Europese bewoners uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk uiteindelijk u Ik heb wel het gevoel dat er in veel hoofden van de mensen dingen aan het evalueren zijn, maar we zien het nog steeds niet in acties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: En het is dringend tijd dat België en zeker ook de EU actie onder... Meer landen Palestina gaan helpen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: En dat er meer hulp komt en dat er minder kinderen worden aangevallen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: En dat er minder erge dingen gebeuren.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In het Verenigd Koninkrijk markeerden honderds van protestanten ook door de stad van Brighton. Dat er minder erge dingen gebeuren. Most are women and children and there are believed to be thousands more uncounted dead civilians buried in the rubble.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Thousands also took to the streets in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Around 1.9 million Palestinians or about 90% of Gaza's population have fled their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to the US Treasury, sanctions against Russia are working.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Their new data shows the ruble is weaker and locals are leaving the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But with sanctions skepticism growing on both sides of the pond, Euronews asked the US Deputy Secretary of the Treasury what proof he had.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russia's economy is smaller. Russia has fewer people today, and their economy is less flexible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: What Russia is today is a wartime economy. They're trying to produce as many weapons as possible, but they're no longer producing things that are going to strengthen their economy over time, and they're spending out the reserves that they've built over years to buy things like, to try and build tanks, but also to buy tankers. While our economies have, we have to admit, suffered because of Russia's war on Ukraine, our economies have been far stronger than Russia's.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And because of our alliance, we have the ability to invest in the future to make sure that our people have opportunities that, frankly, most Russians will never have because of Vladimir Putin's actions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But a major roadblock for the West, making sure sanctions are actually effective.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Does the Treasury have any suggestions to overcome loopholes and sanction circumvention? for the West, making sure sanctions are actually effective.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Does the Treasury have any suggestions to overcome loopholes and sanction circumvention?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Circumvention is a challenge and it's one of the ways we know that our sanctions are working is that the Kremlin has ordered their intelligence services to design ways to try and get around them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But what we've done, working very closely with the European Union, is design an avenue of going after that circumvention using our sanctions and export controls but we've also went out on joint missions between the United States the EU and UK and went to countries where we're seeing circumvention we're making very clear to them they have a choice they can either continue to do business with Russia a small and getting smaller economy in the global sense or they can do business with us. Another big challenge, getting the green light for more funding for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At a summit last week in Brussels, the Hungarian government blocked a 50 billion aid package.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Similarly in the US, cash for Ukraine remains in limbo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Just like in our country, it takes time to work through these packages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The same is true in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: You have to have debates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But ultimately, we are aligned from a values perspective, and we're committed to continue to support the European people as they help us defend Ukraine and provide Ukraine with the resources they need.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And that's what I expect to happen. As politicians debate, the war drags on in Ukraine, with major casualties on both sides. The World Bank says the country will need over 400 billion euros to reconstruct.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Champions League round of 16 has set the stage for some thrilling football, headlined by a heavyweight clash between Barcelona and Napoli.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The draw, which was held in Nyon, has also lined up some other intriguing fixtures as Leipzig will face a stern test against Real Madrid, while Inter Milan's tactical press will be put to the test against Diego Simeone's Atletico de Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere, PSV Eindhoven are set to take on Borussia Dortmund, whilst Arsenal will lock horns with FC Porto.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Defending champions Manchester City are widely tipped as the favourites in their tie against Copenhagen and Bayern Munich will face Italian side Lazio.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Paris Saint-Germain, despite a shaky performance in the group stages that saw them scrape through, have found fortune in the draw.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Luis Enriquez's men will take on Real Sociedad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This matchup spares the French champions from facing off against some of the tournament's giants in this round, notably avoiding clashes with Bayern Munich, Manchester City, Barcelona, Arsenal and Real Madrid.
